intro: Chamaesaracha arida, commonly known as the desert aster, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows as a low, sprawling shrub with hairy, gray-green foliage adapted to conserve water. Its flowers bloom in shades of yellow to white, often appearing in late summer to early fall. Chamaesaracha arida is well-suited to harsh environments and plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils in its native habitat.
